main event: On July 30, 1949, in the vicinity of Portland, Oregon, and Mt. Hood, a group of unidentified lights were sighted by multiple witnesses, including Northwest Airlines pilots, a co-pilot, and a CAA traffic controller.
interesting points: The objects could have been mistaken for two or three planes flying in close formation, although the red lights were on the wrong side for airborne aircraft.
The objects were observed to change course about 90Â° and disappear at a high rate of speed in a southeasterly direction.
Portland Tower reported an object displaying two red lights and one white light, which was seen hovering near the Columbia River before disappearing to the east.
Witnesses observed the object's speed to be around 200 miles per hour and its altitude to be between 6000 and 8000 feet.
The FAA traffic controller attempted to guide the object to a landing using an airport spotlight, believing it to be a helicopter, but the object disappeared when the light was focused on it.
witnesses: Northwest Airlines pilots, co-pilot, CAA traffic controller
